column4: Possibly the file could not be downloaded successfully. checksum is a way to associate a unique id to any file based on a good enough algorithm. The bottom line is: Its always good to download a file again if checksum of original does not match that of downloaded one.
Thanks but I tried to reinstall my OS and it crashes every time
what should I do ?\
Did you download iso and burned it on usb or compactdisk and then installing or Did you get already prepared disk.
How to burn the iso on USB
I think I didn't get your problem. Could u please rephrase the issue you are having?

I shut down my computer and in the morning it coulden`t start
and the massage : "the file is possibly corrupt the file header checksum does not match the computed checksum" appeared
